channel.title: Find Color
channel.description:
FindColor(x,y, rock, 0, 0, 505, 330);
ok, that should find the color (stored in rock) in the box of (0,0) and (505,330), right? Well, how do I get that to assign to a variable?

item.title: Find Color
item.dc:creator: @roberty_bob roberty bob
item.description:
@roberty_bob wrote:

yeah just adding to mike’s contribution…

after you do that find color procedure… you can now just do things such as

MoveMouse(x,y);
wait(300);
ClickMouse(x,y);

except you should include SRL and become familiar with its mouse commands as they are far better and less detectable.

Also if you get familiar with functions such as FindColorSpiralTolerance () your program will be even better.

Read full topic

item.title: Find Color
item.dc:creator: @retributionmike retributionmike
item.description:
@retributionmike wrote:

You have everything right, when it finds that color it saves the coordinates it found it at into the variable x,y at the beginning
right…
FindColor(x,y,rock,0,0,505,330)
there. the bolded ones.

Read full topic
